name: NPR
text:
If you’re a white parent, don’t wait for your kids to bring up the topic of race. Start the discussion before then, says @drjenharvey.

She talked to @NPRMichel about how to have these conversations.
https://t.co/uJwAxU315q https://t.co/GyutDG6BuF

name: NPR
text:
Republican Sen. Lisa Murkowski says she isn't sure she can support President Trump's bid for reelection.

"There are important conversations that we need to have as an American people amongst ourselves about where we are right now," she said Thursday.
https://t.co/REYF78FjFo

name: NPR
text: Retired Gen. Martin Dempsey, former Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman, condemned President Trump's threat to use military force to suppress nationwide protests as "dangerous" and "very troubling." https://t.co/Hm6ewus1Yg

name: NPR
text:
Armed personnel in riot gear with no identification have shown up on the streets of Washington, D.C., during recent protests.

Democratic lawmakers are demanding answers about who they are.
https://t.co/dRdgiN29ZI

name: NPR
text:
A U.S. Navy veteran who was held in Iran for almost two years after being convicted of insulting the country's supreme leader has been released by Iranian authorities, according to his mother.
https://t.co/agmY5kvvja

name: NPR
text:
An autopsy report has ruled that Manuel Ellis' death was a homicide. Ellis, a 33-year-old black man, died in police custody in March in Tacoma, Wash.

He called out "can't breathe" as he was being restrained by officers.
https://t.co/14k3IQWzuT

name: NPR
text:
The ACLU is suing the Trump administration and federal law enforcement agencies, saying they violated the constitutional rights of protesters who were violently evacuated out of a park to clear the path for Trump's photo-op on Monday.
https://t.co/cnHmzQi7gZ

name: NPR
text:
William Bryan told investigators he overheard Travis McMichael use the n-word after he fatally shot Ahmaud Arbery.
 
A special agent on the case was asked if there's evidence McMichael used the n-word at any other time. 

"Yes, sir, many times," he said.
https://t.co/uHj9SEOs68

name: NPR
text:
Breonna Taylor's family and friends are mourning her death — and processing what it means for her to become a national symbol.

"She always said that she would be a legend," said her friend Erinicka Hunter. "I just never imagined it would be like this."
https://t.co/5X14LTKnBo

name: NPR
text:
Russian President Vladimir Putin has declared a state of emergency after 23,000 tons of oil spilled into a remote Arctic region 1,800 miles from Moscow.

The fuel reservoir may have collapsed due to thawing permafrost.
https://t.co/VlRstioTjC

name: NPR
text: RT @LeilaFadel: Many listeners reached out after hearing Safia Munye's story. They wanted to help. Now, people have rallied around her and donated enough for her to rebuild. #GeorgeFloydProtests  https://t.co/NrwjgilBoV

name: NPR
text: On the newest episode of #NPRShortWave, we talk with #BlackBirdersWeek co-founder Chelsea Connor about the challenges black birders face — and how black birders are changing the narrative around who gets to enjoy nature. https://t.co/4Ts1ZHUaxc

name: NPR
text:
"We've had protests at our offices, threats of a shooting and a civil war," one local health official says. "We are desperately trying to scale up contact tracing, but...having to divert funding to hire security guards."

Others report similar experiences. https://t.co/3ZkNAU4evG

name: NPR
text:
The new federal requirement for detailed demographic data for coronavirus test results will go into effect Aug. 1. 

It is designed to help provide long-sought, crucial information needed to monitor and fight the pandemic nationally. https://t.co/jrjXP5rEle

name: NPR
text:
Sejal Shah's collection of essays, "This Is One Way To Dance" delves into what it means to be Indian-American in "delightful" cultural commentary by exploring two realities: She is a born and bred American who is also embedded in the Gujarati diaspora. 
https://t.co/TOdcr9xoFF

name: NPR
text:
Like a lot of great genre writers, Shirley Jackson consistently used thriller conventions to illuminate the phantasms of the mind and turn her own demons into art.  

Josephine Decke's "Shirley" is a worthy testament to her legacy, our critic writes. https://t.co/fnRRm13Vim

name: NPR
text: Mellina White writes for @KUOW about white progressives' shallow efforts to grasp the minority experience. "Pause for a moment and listen. Taking "action" is not sharing the same post everyone else in your echo chamber is sharing." https://t.co/JxQhSt5LFS

name: NPR
text:
Breonna Taylor would have turned 27 today.

Her friends and family remember her as a caring person, someone who loved her job in health care, playing cards with her aunts, falling asleep watching movies with friends.

"We was robbed," said one friend.
https://t.co/hcNM0zNIxm

name: NPR
text:
"Tonight this fight is no longer just the fight of the Traoré family, its everyone's struggle," said Assa Traoré, whose brother, Adama, died in police custody in France in 2016. "We are fighting for our brother, in the U.S. George Floyd, and for Adama."
https://t.co/7tN6D1LdXO

name: NPR
text: The Virginia Legislative Black Caucus said the removal of the Robert E. Lee statue was long overdue — calling it "a constant reminder to Black Virginians of racism, dehumanization, and hate that exists." https://t.co/JVWg2APmSC

name: NPR
text:
NEW: U.S. employers unexpectedly added 2.5 million jobs in May, as the unemployment rate fell to 13.3%. That's still extremely high by historical standards, but much better than forecasters were expecting.
https://t.co/wc1gogHWxs

name: NPR
text: When COVID-19 forced pork companies to close processing plants, some farmers predicted that it would force them to euthanize millions of hogs. But that scenario seems to not be happening. https://t.co/36Nt3M48TO

name: NPR
text:
Friends and family agree that Breonna Taylor was drawn to a career in health care because she cared about people. 

"She always said that she would be a legend," a friend says. "I just never imagined it would be like this."

She would've turned 27 today. https://t.co/LABXT71WTx

name: NPR
text: WATCH LIVE: President Trump is speaking about the unexpectedly strong jobs report for May. https://t.co/H9cP00FOLz

name: NPR
text:
"I do not need my colleague ... to tell me about one lynching in this country."

Rand Paul pushed for changes to an… https://t.co/q5tccBBeCE

name: NPR
text:
A graphic video shows two police officers in Buffalo, N.Y., shoving an elderly man. He hits his head on the ground and lies bleeding while officers march past.

The two officers have been suspended without pay.
https://t.co/vL0pkNnEI2

name: NPR
text:
Rashad Turner had wanted to be a cop for his entire life — then he was arrested on weapons charges for a BB gun in the backseat of his car, and the police he was working for called him "dirty."

He founded a Black Lives Matter chapter in St. Paul instead. https://t.co/L6iVmfjqMk

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: Democratic lawmakers are demanding the Trump administration identify armed law enforcement personnel dispatched during recent protests in Washington, D.C. who wore no identification or agency insignia. https://t.co/WARDdk8aTh

name: NPR
text:
"I'm praying to God," said Bianca Austin, Breonna Taylor's aunt. "We need real change in America. I've got to still raise a little black boy here in the world we live in. ... Nobody's safe. If this can happen to Breonna, it can happen to anybody."
https://t.co/Lrwak2REJ1

name: NPR
text: Berlin has passed its own anti-discrimination law, barring public authorities — including police — from discriminating against anyone based on background, skin color, gender, religion, disabilities, worldview, age, class, education and sexual identity. https://t.co/W96SW2qaBR

name: NPR
text:
A new poll finds the majority of Americans view the nationwide protests for racial justice as legitimate.

It also found that almost half of the country — 47% — strongly disapproves of the job Donald Trump is doing as president.
https://t.co/CSv1VKIVv6

name: NPR
text:
Thousands marched in Nashville to protest police brutality on Thursday. As @SergioMarBel reports, the youth-led demonstration came together following a social media post by one of its 15-year-old organizers.

More from @wpln: https://t.co/5GLMhtaDTS https://t.co/Ud3JYTgDeB

name: NPR
text:
Tens of thousands of people have planned to gather across Australia this weekend to protest the treatment of Indigenous people by police and to show solidarity with U.S. demonstrations calling for racial justice.
https://t.co/MSkgDpgzwo

name: NPR
text:
Rashad Turner had wanted to be a cop for his whole life — then he was arrested on weapons charges for a BB gun in the backseat of his car, and the police he had interned for called him “dirty.” 

He founded a Black Lives Matter chapter in St. Paul instead. https://t.co/g6441REOhP

name: NPR
text: @NPR Note: We have deleted a previous tweet and updated this post to clarify that Rashad Turner was a former police… https://t.co/JomOFRLxuS
